needle: The secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza mentioned in the document are figs, prosciutto, and goat cheese

model_response.text: In 2001, Robert Morris and the other founders of Viaweb started to work on a new application server technology called Arc. They were inspired by Lisp, which had been developed by Tom McCarthy, and wanted to create a language that would allow for rapid development of online applications. They designed a set of libraries that allowed them to do so efficiently and made it possible to create applications that were web-based and interactive. They also developed a framework for managing the server-side logic and creating a user-friendly interface. Their approach was based on Lisp macros, which allowed for the creation of complex expressions and loops, making the language more powerful and easier to use.
